com.edugility.objexj.engine
Class ProgramCounter<T>

java.lang.Object
  com.edugility.objexj.engine.ProgramCounter<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of Object processed by the Program affiliated with ProgramCounter instances
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Instruction<T>>, Iterator<Instruction<T>>
public class ProgramCounter<T>
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Serializable, Iterable<Instruction<T>>, Iterator<Instruction<T>>

A marriage of a Program and an index into that Program, and hence also an Iterator and Iterable of Instructions.

Author:
Laird Nelson
See Also:
Program, Instruction, Serialized Form

Creates a new ProgramCounter.

IllegalArgumentException - if program is null

ProgramCounter

public ProgramCounter(ProgramCounter<T> programCounter)
Creates a new ProgramCounter.

Parameters:
programCounter - a ProgramCounter whose affiliated Program will be used and whose index will also be used; must not be null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if programCounter is null or somehow has a Program that is null

ProgramCounter

                      int index)
Creates a new ProgramCounter.

index - the index to be affiliated with this ProgramCounter
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if program is null, or if the supplied index is not valid
See Also:
isValid(int), setIndex(int)

next

public final Instruction<T> next()
Calls the advance() method, and if it returns true, returns the result of calling the getInstruction() method. Otherwise throws a NoSuchElementException.

Specified by:
next in interface Iterator<Instruction<T>>
Returns:
an Instruction, or null
Throws:
NoSuchElementException - if there are no further Instructions
See Also:
advance(), getInstruction(), hasNext()

getIndex

public int getIndex()
Returns the index managed by this ProgramCounter.

The index returned by this method is guaranteed to be valid. Subclasses who choose to override this method must preserve these semantics.

Returns:
the (valid) index managed by this ProgramCounter
See Also:
setIndex(int)

setIndex

public final void setIndex(int index)
Sets the index managed by this ProgramCounter to the supplied index, provided that it is valid.

Parameters:
index - the new index; must be valid
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if index not valid

canAdvance

public final boolean canAdvance()
Returns true if this ProgramCounter can advance its internal index by one.

Returns:
true if the current index plus one is valid; false otherwise

advance

public boolean advance()
Attempts to advance the index and returns true if the attempt was successful.

Returns:
true if this ProgramCounter was in a state where it could advance and did; false otherwise

getInstruction

public final Instruction<T> getInstruction()
Returns the Instruction located at the current index, or null if no such Instruction was found.

This method may return null.

Returns:
the Instruction at the current index, or null
Throws:
InvalidProgramCounterException - if this ProgramCounter is not valid

isValid

public final boolean isValid()
Returns true if this ProgramCounter is valid.

Returns:
true if the isValid(int) method returns true when supplied with the current index; false otherwise

isValid

public final boolean isValid(int index)
Returns true if the isValid(Program, int) method returns true when supplied with the current Program and the supplied index.

Returns:
true if the isValid(Program, int) method returns true when supplied with the current Program and the supplied index

isValid

public static final boolean isValid(Program<?> program,
                                    int index)
Returns true if the supplied Program and index represent a valid combination.

Effectively this means the supplied Program:

  • Must not be null.

The supplied index:

  • Must be greater than or equal to 0
  • Must be less than the size of the supplied Program

Parameters:
program - the Program to test; may be null in which case false will be returned
index - the index to test; may be less than 0 in which case false will be returned
Returns:
true if the supplied Program and index represent a valid combination; false otherwise
